title: Direct STEM Probing of Short-Range Order in Cation-Disordered Oxide Cathode
content: A random occupancy of multi-species atoms at the same equivalent lattice site results in, crystallographically, a crystalline solid solution that is chemically fully disordered. Often, when the atomic occupancy at neighboring lattice sites is correlated within only a short distance, a chemical short-range order (SRO) emerges, which has been noticed to dictate the mechanical, magnetic, thermoelectric, and electrochemical properties of crystalline solid solutions.
